security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. Single SKILL.md file describes CLI tool usage for multi-agent coordination.

content.user_title: Coordinate multi-agent swarms with Hive Mind
content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI agents for complex tasks is challenging. The Hive Mind system uses a queen-led architecture to orchestrate specialized workers with consensus mechanisms and persistent collective memory.
actual_capabilities: Initialize and manage queen-led multi-agent swarms
Build consensus using majority, weighted, or Byzantine algorithms
Store and retrieve knowledge in collective memory
Spawn specialized workers (researcher, coder, tester, analyst, architect, reviewer)
Pause, resume, and checkpoint agent sessions
Generate Claude Code Task commands for swarm coordination
limitations: No direct code execution within skill
Network access depends on claude-flow configuration
Consensus requires at least 3 agents for meaningful voting

use_cases.title: Research Analysis
use_cases.description: Deploy researcher and analyst agents to investigate topics and build consensus on findings

use_cases.title: Full-Stack Development
use_cases.description: Coordinate frontend, backend, DevOps, and security agents for complete project delivery

use_cases.title: PR Review Coordination
use_cases.description: Spawn multiple specialist reviewers to analyze code quality, security, and performance

prompt_templates.title: Initialize Hive Mind
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Hive Mind to initialize a new swarm for [OBJECTIVE] with [QUEEN_TYPE] queen type and [CONSENSUS] consensus algorithm

prompt_templates.title: Spawn Development Team
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn a development hive with coder, tester, reviewer, and architect agents for [PROJECT]

prompt_templates.title: Research Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Research [TOPIC] using adaptive queen with byzantine consensus. Store findings in collective memory

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Hive Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Run frontend and backend hives simultaneously that share collective memory for [APPLICATION]

output_examples.input: Spawn a development hive to build a REST API
output: Queen Coordinator: Orchestrates API development strategy
Backend Developer: Implements Express routes and controllers
Database Architect: Designs PostgreSQL schema and queries
Test Engineer: Creates Jest test suite with 90% coverage
Security Auditor: Reviews authentication and authorization
Consensus: Agents vote on architecture decisions
Memory: API patterns stored for future reference

best_practices: Choose queen type based on task: strategic for planning, tactical for implementation, adaptive for optimization
Use Byzantine consensus for critical decisions requiring 2/3 agent agreement
Store learnings in collective memory to improve future task assignment
anti_patterns: Using majority consensus for security-critical decisions (insufficient fault tolerance)
Spawning workers without defining clear objectives
Skipping session checkpoints during long-running tasks

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires claude-flow CLI for full functionality.

faq.question: How many agents can coordinate?
faq.answer: Supports up to 12 workers by default with auto-scaling. Configure maxWorkers in hive config.

faq.question: Can I integrate with GitHub?
faq.answer: Yes. Use hive-mind spawn with repo objectives or PR numbers for coordinated code review.

faq.question: Is my data safe in collective memory?
faq.answer: Memory is local to your session. Use encryption: true in config for sensitive data.

faq.question: What if consensus fails?
faq.answer: Switch to weighted consensus where queen vote counts 3x, or use simple majority for faster decisions.

faq.question: How does this compare to basic swarm?
faq.answer: Hive Mind adds queen-led hierarchy, Byzantine consensus, persistent memory, and session management.
